title: Winzer Krems 2016 Ried Pfaffenberg Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)
description: A faint note of lemon zest plays on the tender nose of this wine. On the palate, lemon takes over, accented by a richer edge of pineapple. It's zesty, brisk and concentrated, providing spine and spark, with a clean, citrus-focused and moreish finish. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Wohlmuth 2016 Alte Reben Gewürztraminer (Südsteiermark)
description: This wine's rose petal, orange zest and Mandarin aromas rise headily from the glass. The palate frames this aromatic surfeit with a wonderfully creamy texture and an electric streak of freshness that recalls lemon pith. It comes together in a sophisticated package of pleasure that combines fragrant abundance with precision and dryness.

title: Brezza 2011 Sarmassa Vigna Bricco Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Inviting aromas of wild berry, pressed rose, new leather, culinary spice and a balsamic note lift out of the glass. On the imposing, full-bodied palate, licorice and pipe tobacco notes accent raspberry compote and steeped cherry framed in firm, fine-grained tannins. You'll also notice the warmth of alcohol on the close but it's well supported by chewy fruit. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Buchegger 2016 Ried Vordernberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: Both pear and citrus pith inform the shy nose of this wine. The palate expresses more of that pithy citrus, adding streaks of bright lemon and the slightest touch of salty yeast. It's concentrated yet taut and utterly refreshing, with an almost cleansing quality.

title: Clos Saint Michel 2015 G-S-M (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Whiffs of black pepper, licorice and vanilla lend a warm, spicy tone to ripe blueberry and black cherry flavors in this bold, richly concentrated wine that's both unctuously fruity and earthy. The finish is warm and supple, marked by fine, persistent tannins.

title: Domaine Anita 2016 Très Vieille Vigne Les Caves  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Sourced from a parcel of 80-year-old vines, this wine is rich and dense, with a strong mineral texture and ripe black plum and cherry flavors. Drink this powerful, concentrated and structured wine from 2019.

title: Domaines Dominique Piron 2016 La Chanaise  (Morgon)
description: This large, 61-acre, vineyard forms part of the Piron properties. The wine has great concentration and a dense ripe texture that comes from low-yielding, 50-year-old vines. Let this wine fill out even more. Drink from late 2018.

title: Domäne Wachau 2016 Smaragd Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: This wine has that lovely mix of citrus zest and pith on both the nose and palate. The two vie for attention, giving both freshness and texture. The flavors are highlighted by lemon but also informed by greener, savory hints of ivy, celery and fennel. White pepper makes an intriguing appearance on the dry finish.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Azaya Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marin County)
description: Delicious fruitiness and full body are a winning combination in this luxuriously oaky, very ripe-tasting and impressive wine from Marin County—not exactly a household name for wine, but it should be. The black cherry and stewed-plum flavors are so rich they seem sweet, but a good structure of acidity and firm tannins keeps the wine balanced.

title: Ebner-Ebenauer 2016 Alte Reben Weisser Burgunder (Niederösterreich)
description: A hazelnut element lends richness to the slender, translucent, bright Golden Delicious apple and ripe pear notes in this wine. It seems infinitely svelte and rich at the same time. The palate is smooth with ample brightness but ripples with fresh and unclouded brightness. The finish is dry, fresh and very long.

title: Gainey 2015 Limited Selection Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There is extreme florality throughout this bottling, starting with wisteria and dark carnations on the bright and fresh nose, alongside black raspberry fruit. The flowers are a bit more subdued on the sip, yet violet, lilac and rosewater flavors persist, decorating the suave strawberry and rhubarb background.

title: Geyerhof 2016 Ried Gaisberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: Russet pear peel and citrus pith notes hovers above the savory, yeasty nose of this wine. The palate then gives full rein to wonderully rounded, salty soy notes, which ring with citrus freshness and ripe pear notes through the midpalate. Beautifully balanced, concentrated and very appetizing.

title: Isole e Olena 2014  Chianti Classico
description: Fragrant and refined, this radiant red opens with enticing scents of wild berry, aromatic herb, dark spice, menthol and whiffs of tilled soil and pressed blue flower. Ethereally elegant and boasting great tension, the palate delivers succulent red cherry, raspberry, clove and a hint of licorice while vibrant acidity and polished, fine-grained tannins lend balance and support. Drink through 2024.

title: Jean-Michel Dupré 2016 1935 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)
description: Even in old-vine Beaujolais terms, vines planted in 1935 are rare. These come from a small parcel within the Grand Cras sector of Morgon and produce a richly concentrated wine. With firm tannins, ripe black fruits and balanced acidity, this dense wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2015 Frauenfeld St. Laurent (Thermenregion)
description: An aromatic streak of wild cherry flashes up on the nose and completely takes over on the smooth palate. This is structured by finely woven tannins, corsetting the beautifully judged fruit. At the perfect juncture of freshness and ripeness, this brims with sensuous, red cherry fruit.

title: Josef Bauer 2016 Ried Spiegel Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)
description: A creamy, subdued ripe pear aroma is the first impression this wine gives. The palate counters with ample freshness and a wonderfully textured mouthfeel that combines cream, fruit, celery salt and citrus pith notes. All the concentration is cushioned with generous fruit and invigorating freshness.

title: Jurtschitsch 2016 Ried Loiserberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: A flinty touch of reduction colors the pear and yeast notes on the nose of this wine. The palate shows all the characteristic savory richness of yeast, but here it seems to sparkle with lightness and brisk, lemony freshness, finishing on savory notes of sage and fennel. Although slender, it's full of flavor.

title: K Vintners 2014 El Jefe Stoneridge Vineyard Tempranillo (Washington)
description: The aromas are sweet and sappy, with notes of raspberry, herb, pipe tobacco and musk. The palate shows more restraint than the aromas might suggest, bringing a suave sense that carries through a finish that just won't quit. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery, bringing a lot of richness.

title: La Jota Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine, juicy and broad on the palate with mouth-filling tannins that show its youthful vigor. Cherry and raspberry liqueur flavors run deep, wrapped in sizable oak and well-integrated accents of cedar and dried herb. This stands to be cellared; enjoy best 2024 through 2029.

title: Laurence Féraud 2014 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Savory tones of tobacco leaf, dried lavender and thyme lend a dark, sultry appeal to rich blackberry and plum here. This wine is fleshy on the palate yet firmly balanced with fine, taut tannins and a lingering, brambly finish. Graceful and nuanced, it should drink at prime through 2030.

title: Loimer 2016 Ried Loiserberg Riesling (Kamptal)
description: A touch of reduction still lets this come across as brooding. But lemon zest and dried hay flower flavors come to the fore with a little air. The concentrated midpalate boasts zestiness and a yeasty texture. This will deliver joy, poise and refreshment with its pervasive lemon notes. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Matetic 2012 Syrah (San Antonio)
description: If you know Matetic Syrah, then this will be like an old friend coming back for a visit. The nose is earthy and dense, with the winery's patented mix of heady herbal fruit and eucalyptus aromas. A chewy palate spreads its wings with grace and strength, while this tastes of toasty oak, medicinal black fruits and minty herbs. Drink through 2022.

title: Montes 2013 Folly Syrah (Apalta)
description: Plenty of up-front oak makes for a nose with char and smoke on top of perfumed black fruit. A profoundly deep palate is fairly tannic and firm. Flavors of black plum, dark chocolate, herbs and pepper finish more dry than jammy, with tea and wood spice notes. Drink through 2025.

title: Muhr-Van der Niepoort 2015 Samt & Seide Blaufränkisch (Carnuntum)
description: Pure notes of crushed blueberry have a wonderfully tart edge, almost like wild little huckleberries. The same, pure and intense fruit spreads across the textured body where fine and ever so slightly rustic tannins crunch pleasurably. This wine shows the juicy, almost voluptuous ripeness of 2015 without ever losing freshness or tone. This should come with some sort of pleasure warning. Simply delicious. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Mullineux 2015 Iron Syrah (Swartland)
description: This Syrah has an old-world soul, with pronounced earthy scents of game, tobacco leaf, chicory root and loads of white pepper that grace notes of black cherry and raspberry fruit. The velvety palate boasts smooth yet enduring tannins, while flavors of charred animal hide, cherry skin and forest floor carry through to the long, evolving finish, ending with a soft sanguine accent. While it's enticing now, it should mature gracefully through 2028.

title: Nautilus 2015 Southern Valleys Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This wine combines so much of what we've come to love about New Zealand Pinot. It's light and bright but serious too, with plenty of site expression. Raspberry and blueberry compote, violets, baking spices and sun-baked stones all dance together on the nose. There's plush fruit on the palate but a savoriness too, framed by sinewy tannins and finishing on a stoney, mineral note.

title: Netzl 2015 Ried Haidacker Zweigelt (Carnuntum)
description: A shy, restrained nose hints at red cherry, red plum and cherry juice. The palate, on the other hand, brims with aroamtic cherries: black and red, ripe and luscious but always fresh. It is the slender freshness and appealing texture of fine tannin that makes this both elegant and moreish. Wonderfully concentrated but somehow understated despite its juiciness.

title: Patland 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine goes to the limit with ripeness and full body, showing an especially dark color, very ripe and effusive fruit flavors like macerated cherries and blackberry jam and a mouth-filling texture packed with lots of expansive tannins. It's hard to resist its exuberance and concentration.

title: Patrick Tranchand 2015 Poncié  (Fleurie)
description: This wine is ripe, structured, full of fruit and rich. It also is elegant, with a spacious texture and smooth fruit full of black-plum flavors. Drink this wine now.

title: Prieler 2016 Pinot Blanc (Leithaberg)
description: This wine's beautiful red and yellow apple fruit has a zesty edge of lemon. On the palate, a more textured element reminiscent of apple peel and lemon pith adds body. Freshness pervades the wonderfully elegant and earthy flavors. The finish is bright, dry and fresh with lemon. Lovely now, it's sure to develop. Drink 2018–2028.
